intro: Sida vogelii, commonly known as Vogel's mallows, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sida vogelii is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both moist and dry environments.
